str2: A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From zemia; to injure, i.e. to experience detriment.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
